POWER UP: BUSINESS SPEAK

Unlock the vocabulary of success.

Energize the class. This is vocabulary drill time. Next: Vocab - Set Up.

Image by moerschy from Pixabay

SET UP

(Phrasal Verb)

"The company was set up in 1991."

= Started/Founded

Pronunciation: /set ʌp/

Drill pronunciation. Check linking /set_ʌp/. Next: Vocab - Headquarters.

Image by 738189 from Pixabay

HEADQUARTERS

(Noun)

"Apple's headquarters are in California."

= Main Office/HQ

Pronunciation: /HEAD-quar-ters/

Emphasize stress on first syllable. Note plural form. Next: Vocab - Expand.

EXPAND

(Verb)

"We need to expand into new markets."

= Get bigger/Grow

Form: expand, expanded, expanding

Connect to "expansion". Elicit examples. Next: Quest 1 segue.

Task 1: People Check

People or Organization?

Tick (✓) the words that refer to PEOPLE.

✓ PEOPLE WORDS

  • ✅ Accountant (A person who manages money)
  • ✅ Employee (A person who works for a firm)
  • ✅ Client (A person who pays for services)
  • ✅ Expert (A person with special knowledge)
  • ✅ Contacts (People you know in business)
Confirm all answers. Clarify any confusion. Next: Task 2 Instructions.

Task 2: Synonym Match

Replace the underlined words with business vocabulary.

Students work individually. Monitor progress. Next: Answer 2.1 (Daily).

Task 2: Q1

"The food is delivered every day."

⬇

"The food is delivered DAILY."

Why? "Every day" means it happens daily.
Check spelling of 'daily'. Next: Answer 2.2.

Task 2: Q2

"There is a real need..."

⬇

"...real DEMAND for organic food."

Why? When people want/need a product, there is "demand".
Collocation: 'High demand'. Next: Answer 2.3.

Task 2: Q3

"Our plan is to open..."

⬇

"Our AIM is to open..."

Why? Your "aim" is your future goal or plan.
Aim = Target/Goal. Next: Answer 2.4.

Task 2: Q4

"The company is doing well."

⬇

"The FIRM is doing well."

Why? "Firm" is a synonym for business/company.
Law firm, accountancy firm. Next: Answer 2.5.

Task 2: Q5

"We have 25 workers."

⬇

"We have 25 EMPLOYEES."

Why? People who work for a company are employees.
Employee (worker) vs Employer (boss). Next: Answer 2.6.

Task 2: Q6

"I started the business..."

⬇

"I SET UP the business..."

Why? To "set up" means to start/create a business.
Phrasal verb recall. Next: Answer 2.7.

Task 2: Q7

"Their main offices are..."

⬇

"Their HEADQUARTERS are..."

Why? The most important office is the HQ.
Pronunciation: Stress 1st syllable. Next: Answer 2.8.

Task 2: Q8

"He's hoping for a job..."

⬇

"He's hoping for a POSITION..."

Why? In business, a specific job title is a "position".
More formal than 'job'. Next: Answer 2.9.

Task 2: Q9

"The firm is getting bigger."

⬇

"The firm is EXPANDING."

Why? To "expand" means to grow/open branches.
Continuous form check (is expanding). Next: Answer 2.10.

Task 2: Q10

"The company made a lot of money."

⬇

"...made A GREAT DEAL of money."

Why? Formal phrase for "a large amount".
Formal/Business register. Next: Quest 2 Segue.

QUEST 2: PRECISION STRIKE

Choose the exact word.

Task 3: Multiple choice/Gap fill. Next: Task 3 Instructions.

Task 3: Best Word Choice

Choose the best business word to complete each sentence.

Monitor for collocations (experts IN, take UP). Next: Answer 3.1.

Task 3: Q1

"They're experts in farming."

Why? We always say "expert IN" a field.
Collocation check: Expert IN. Next: Answer 3.2.

Task 3: Q2

"When did you take up tennis?"

Why? You "take up" a hobby. You "set up" a business.
Phrasal verb distinction. Next: Answer 3.3.

Task 3: Q3

"Her law firm has many famous clients."

Why? Lawyers/Professionals have clients. Shops have customers.
Client vs Customer distinction. Next: Answer 3.4.

Task 3: Q4

"She's actually my ex-wife."

Why? "Ex-" is for relationships. "Former" is for job titles.
Prefix distinction. Next: Answer 3.5.

Task 3: Q5

"When did they set up the company?"

Why? To "set up" means to start/build a company.
Synonym for start/establish. Next: Answer 3.6.

Task 3: Q6

"The shop assistant was serving a customer."

Why? In a shop, the buyer is a "customer".
Shop context = Customer. Next: Answer 3.7.

Task 3: Q7

"He's currently working abroad."

Why? "Currently" means right now.
Currently vs Actually false friend check. Next: Answer 3.8.

Task 3: Q8

"Are they planning to take over the company?"

Why? "Take over" means to buy/acquire control.
Acquisition context. Next: Answer 3.9.

Task 3: Q9

"George Bush is a former president."

Why? Use "Former" for past official job titles.
Title context (not ex-president). Next: Boss Level Segue.

BOSS LEVEL: TRANSFORMATION

Rewrite reality. Keep the meaning.

High energy! This is the hardest part. Next: Task 4 Instructions.

Task 4: Rewrite

Rewrite the sentences using the word in CAPITALS.

Monitor closely. This is B1+ level difficulty. Next: Answer 4.1 (Variety).

Task 4: Q1

"He makes different cakes."

⬇

Task 4: Q1

"He makes different cakes."

⬇

"He makes a VARIETY of cakes."

Why? "Variety" (Noun) = many different types.
Key word transformation: different -> variety of. Next: Answer 4.2.

Task 4: Q2

"They were very successful."

⬇

Task 4: Q2

"They were very successful."

⬇

"They ACHIEVED a great deal."

Why? To "achieve" success means to reach your goal.
Collocation: Achieve a great deal/success. Next: Answer 4.3.

Task 4: Q3

"I know a lot of people in banking."

⬇

Task 4: Q3

"I know a lot of people..."

⬇

"I have many CONTACTS in banking."

Why? "Contacts" are useful people you know.
Networking context. Next: Answer 4.4.

Task 4: Q4

"They used to be called BMG."

⬇

Task 4: Q4

"They used to be called..."

⬇

"They were FORMERLY known as BMG."

Why? "Formerly" is formal for "in the past".
Formal business change of name. Next: Answer 4.5.

Task 4: Q5

"I've always wanted to fly a plane."

⬇

Task 4: Q5

"I've always wanted..."

⬇

"It's my AMBITION to fly a plane."

Why? Ambition = Strong desire/goal for the future.
Noun vs Verb structure transformation. Next: Answer 4.6.

Task 4: Q6

"She has a great knowledge of finance."

⬇

Task 4: Q6

"She has a great knowledge of..."

⬇

"She is an EXPERT in finance."

Why? An expert is a person who knows a lot.
Collocation: Expert IN (Review from Task 3). Next: Answer 4.7.

Task 4: Q7

"People noticed the adverts."

⬇

Task 4: Q7

"People noticed the adverts."

⬇

"The adverts attracted a lot of ATTENTION."

Why? To "attract attention" = make people look/notice.
Passive/Active switch + Collocation. Next: Final Quest.

Final Quest: The Success Story

Danielle Spinks

Complete the text with the correct word form.

Final consolidation task. Next: Answer 5.1.

Gap 1: DELIVER

"...Danielle promised to deliver them..."

Couriers deliver documents.
Verb form check.

Gap 2: FIRM/BUSINESS

"It was only a small firm/business..."

Both answers acceptable.
Synonyms.

Gap 3: ACHIEVED

"...but DCS achieved immediate success..."

Past tense of achieve.
Past simple regular.

Gap 4: BRANCH

"...so Danielle set up another branch..."

A new office in a different city.
Singular noun.

Gap 5: RUN

"...which was run by her brother..."

Passive voice: was run (manage).
Irregular verb: Run-Ran-Run.

Gap 6: EXPANDED

"The business soon expanded rapidly..."

Got bigger/grew larger.
Past simple regular.

Gap 7: AMBITION

"...it is now Danielle's ambition to have..."

Her big future goal.
Noun form.
